Subject: Eric S. Raymond 'Ask Me Anything!'
Description: Eric S. Raymond answers your questions about anything!  Speakers include:Eric S. Raymond - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Where Did the Heroes Go?
Description: Science fiction and fantasy were once known for stories with strong, capable heroes and heroines. We take a look at heroes and what's happened to them lately.  Speakers include:Jay Maynard, Eric S. Raymond, Jon David, Stewart Sternberg - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Tastes that Taste Great Together
Description: Join Cathy and Eric Raymond for a different kind of chocolate tasting: tastes of dark chocolate combined with other flavors and foods, such as bacon!  Or vanilla!  This tasting will include a talk about foods that were historically combined with chocolate in South America and, later, in Europe. This is a limited attendance event.  Please sign up in advance at Ops.  Speakers include:Cathy Raymond, Eric S. Raymond - Track: Food  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Tools for Outlines: M.I.C.E., The Three Act Structure
Description: Is your story about Milieu, an Idea, a Character, or an Event? Figure out what sort of story you want to tell, and see which elements are most important, how you might want to structure the story, and how to tell if you've reached the end.   Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Ericka S. Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Michael K. Elliot - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Mechanics of Magic in Fantasy & SF
Description: Does a magical system for a story need rules? Costs, unintended consequences, social factors? What about reliability issues? How can we avoid worn-out tropes. How should magic in an RPG and story differ? Is some of the tech in SF 'magic' and should the same considerations apply?  Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Ericka S. Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Andrew Zimmerman Jones - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes
